tasks.title: Grafana MCP Alert Collector
tasks.description: Implement async data collector that fetches previous 24h alerts from Grafana MCP using httpx and returns normalised objects.
tasks.details:
‚Ä¢ Endpoint: `/api/alertmanager/grafana/api/v2/alerts?since=<iso>` (example; confirm via mcp.json). Use bearer token header.
‚Ä¢ Calculate `since = now - lookback_hours` in UTC; include timezone in query.
‚Ä¢ Design dataclass Alert(
  id:str, service:str, severity:str, starts_at:dt, ends_at:Optional[dt], description:str, status:str)
‚Ä¢ Handle pagination (Grafana returns link header) with async recursion.
‚Ä¢ Retry w/ backoff on 5xx using backoff lib.

subtasks.details: Deliver a concise API reference (endpoint paths, required headers, pagination scheme, rate limits) and create a typed settings object (pydantic BaseSettings) that loads base URL and bearer token from the environment or .env file.

subtasks.title: Alert dataclass design & parsing helpers
subtasks.description: Define the Alert dataclass and utility functions that map raw Grafana alert JSON into normalised Alert objects, handling optional fields and timezone-aware datetime parsing.
subtasks.details: Implement Alert(id: str, service: str, severity: str, starts_at: datetime, ends_at: Optional[datetime], description: str, status: str). Provide from_grafana(payload: dict) -> Alert and list_from_response(resp_json: list) -> List[Alert]. Ensure all datetime values are converted to UTC and are tz-aware.

subtasks.title: Async fetcher with lookback query construction
subtasks.description: Implement an async function fetch_alert_page since=<iso> that builds the query using UTC now() - lookback_hours (default 24) and performs a single HTTP GET with httpx including bearer token header.
subtasks.details: Use httpx.AsyncClient with a 10 s timeout. Compute since_iso = (datetime.utcnow() - timedelta(hours=lookback)).isoformat(timespec='seconds') + 'Z'. Return httpx.Response for further processing.

subtasks.title: Pagination, retry/backoff, and aggregation to Alert objects
subtasks.description: Compose the recursive collector that follows Link headers to fetch all pages, applies exponential backoff (backoff.on_exception) on 5xx, aggregates results, and returns List[Alert] using the parsing helpers.
subtasks.details: Implement async def collect_alerts(lookback_hours=24) -> List[Alert]. On each response, check response.headers['Link'] for rel="next"; call itself until exhausted. Wrap network calls with backoff expo (max_tries=5, jitter). Transform each page‚Äôs JSON via list_from_response and extend the result list.
